product_name: Casio G-Shock GWM850-7 Atomic Solar Watch
long_description: Whatever life throws at you, you can count on the Casio G-Shock GWM850-7 Atomic Solar watch to deliver with self-adjusting accuracy and legendary shock- and water-resistance. Multi-band atomic timekeeping (in the U.S., U.K., Germany, Japan, China) receives time-calibrating radio signals up to six times per day (five times per day in China). Tough solar power technology eliminates the need to ever change a battery; built-in solar panel converts sunlight and fluorescent light into energy. Shock-resistant case resists water down to 200m (660 ft.). Auto EL backlight with afterglow lets you see the display in the dark. World Time features 29 times zones, 48 cities, city code display and daylight saving on/off. Four daily alarms; snooze; stopwatch; hourly chime; countdown timer; auto calendar. 1/100-second stopwatch measures elapsed time, split time and 1st-place/2nd-place times. Rally mode allows for simultaneous starting of the stopwatch and linked timer. The Casio G-Shock GWM850-7 Atomic Solar watch features a battery that lasts up to 7 months on a full charge (without further exposure to light).
short_description: Whatever life throws at you, you can count on the Casio G-Shock GWM850-7 Atomic Solar watch to deliver with self-adjusting accuracy and legendary shock- and water-resistance.
